snippet: The proposed deal covers about 1.5 million Tacoma and Tundra pickup trucks and Sequoia S.U.V.s suspected of receiving inadequate rust protection....
abstract: Toyota Motors agrees to pay $3.4 billion to settle federal class-action lawsuit in Los Angeles brought by pickup truck and sports utility vehicle owners accusing automaker of inadequate rust protection; settlement will cover potential frame replacement costs for about 1.5 million Tacomas, Tundras and Sequoias built between 2005 to 2010.
lead_paragraph: The proposed deal covers about 1.5 million Tacoma and Tundra pickup trucks and Sequoia S.U.V.s suspected of receiving inadequate rust protection.

headline.main: Toyota Agrees to $3.4 Billion Settlement in Corrosion Case
headline.print_headline: $3.4 Billion Settlement in Toyota Rust Case

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Sports Utility Vehicles and Light Trucks
